required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: rTMS and EF Training for Working Memory Deficits in Adolescent Psychopathology
clinical_study.official_title: rTMS and Executive Functioning Training for Working Memory Deficits in Adolescent Psychopathology

brief_summary.textblock: Cognitive deficits occur across the spectrum of adolescent psychopathology and are one of the most significant predictors of clinical and functional outcomes. While cognition remains a highly understudied and undertreated domain in psychiatry, emerging evidence suggests that repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) and cognitive training may possess significant cognition enhancing effects. We have previously shown that cognitive dysfunction, particularly executive functioning (EF) deficits, is strongly associated with treatment-related outcomes in children with psychiatric disorders. The primary objective of this project is to conduct a randomized, single-blind, sham-controlled pilot study investigating the added effectiveness of rTMS at the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) to a novel EF training program in an effort to transiently enhance EF in adolescents with psychopathology and working memory deficits. EF task performance will be measured with cognitive measures of working memory, inhibition, and flexibility. EF-related neural oscillations will be measured with resting-state electroencephalogram (EEG), specifically examining fronto-parietal gamma power and theta-gamma coupling. The primary hypothesis is that the addition of rTMS to EF training will result in increased EF task performance and increased resting-state fronto-parietal gamma power and theta-gamma coupling, with rTMS administered prior to EF training producing a stronger effect than rTMS administered after EF training. There remains a dearth of available treatments for EF deficits, particularly in adolescents. With an expert mentorship team in adolescent psychopathology and neuromodulation, this study will test a highly novel and promising combination of brain stimulation and skill training to efficiently improve EF (including underlying brain activity) in adolescents with EF deficits.

primary_outcome.measure: Compared to sham condition, activation of the left DLPFC prior to EF training will temporarily increase working memory performance as measured by the NIH Toolbox List Sorting Work Memory Test (LSWMT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Task performance will be measured immediately prior to and following the active and sham rTMS/EF training sessions.
primary_outcome.description: The NIH Toolbox LSWMT is a performance-based neuropsychological test of working memory

primary_outcome.measure: Compared to sham condition, activation of the left DLPFC prior to EF training will temporarily increase inhibition performance as measured by the NIH Toolbox Flanker Test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Task performance will be measured immediately prior to and following the active and sham rTMS/EF training sessions.
primary_outcome.description: The NIH Toolbox Flanker Test is a performance-based neuropsychological test of inhibition

primary_outcome.measure: Compared to sham condition, activation of the left DLPFC prior to EF training will temporarily increase cognitive flexibility performance as measured by the NIH Toolbox Dimensional Card Sorting Test (DCST)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Task performance will be measured immediately prior to and following the active and sham rTMS/EF training sessions.
primary_outcome.description: The NIH Toolbox DCST is a performance-based neuropsychological test of cognitive flexibility

secondary_outcome.measure: Compared to rTMS administered following EF training, rTMS administered prior to EF training will produce a stronger effect on working memory performance, as measured by the NIH Toolbox LSWMT.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Task performance will be measured immediately prior to and following the active and sham rTMS/EF training sessions.
secondary_outcome.description: The NIH Toolbox LSWMT is a performance-based neuropsychological test of working memory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compared to rTMS administered following EF training, rTMS administered prior to EF training will produce a stronger effect on inhibition performance, as measured by the NIH Toolbox Flanker.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Task performance will be measured immediately prior to and following the active and sham rTMS/EF training sessions.
secondary_outcome.description: The NIH Toolbox Flanker Test is a performance-based neuropsychological test of inhibition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compared to rTMS administered following EF training, rTMS administered prior to EF training will produce a stronger effect on cognitive flexibility performance, as measured by the NIH Toolbox DCST
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Task performance will be measured immediately prior to and following the active and sham rTMS/EF training sessions.
secondary_outcome.description: The NIH Toolbox DCST is a performance-based neuropsychological test of cognitive flexibility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compared to sham condition, activation of the left DLPFC prior to EF training will temporarily increase resting-state, fronto-parietal gamma power and theta-gamma coupling as measured by resting state scalp EEG.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: EEG will be measured immediately prior to and following the active and sham rTMS/EF training sessions.

intervention.intervention_name: Magstim Super Rapid2 stimulator, Active condition
intervention.description: 10 Hz (2,000 pulses) at left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex

intervention.intervention_name: Magstim Super Rapid2 stimulator, Sham condition

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 13-17 years
- Letter-Number Sequencing performance: < 1.5 standard deviations (SDs) below normative mean
- Parent rating on BRIEF-2 Working Memory: > 1.5 SDs above normative mean
- Intelligence > 80
- Right handed
- Clinical diagnosis of 1+ psychiatric disorder
- Ability to provide informed consent/assent
- English fluency
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical conditions contraindicated for rTMS, including intracranial pathology, epilepsy or seizures, acquired brain injury (including traumatic brain injury, stroke, brain tumor), implanted medical devices, and other serious medical conditions
- Chronic treatment with prescription medications that decrease cortical seizure threshold
- Significant visual, hearing, or speech impairment
- History of fainting spells of unknown or undetermined etiology that might constitute seizures
- First degree relative with seizures or epilepsy
- Active psychosis

overall_official.affiliation: E. P. Bradley Hospital/Alpert Medical School of Brown University
